oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interstate 7 Show - Loretta Lynn and Ernest Ray interview - Jack Reno - 1978 - WLW - part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of a segment of the Interstate 7 Show with Jack Reno (host), featuring Loretta Lynn (performer) and Ernest Ray Lynn (performer), broadcast in 1978 on radio station WLW (Cincinnati, Ohio).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [Unidentified] introduces Jack Reno -- (00:15) Spring Fever (Loretta Lynn) [recorded excerpt] -- (02:50) Jack Reno introduces Loretta Lynn, and compliments her records -- (03:18) Loretta talks about living in Humphrey's county, out in the countryside -- (03:42) Loretta talks about owning the town there, and putting up a post office there -- (04:03) Loretta talks about the town being included when she bought a house there, in Hurricane Mills, Tennessee -- (04:54) Loretta talks about selling her rodeo, and having 5,000 acres -- (05:12) Loretta talks about her husband farming a lot of their land -- (05:35) Loretta talks about her duderanch -- (06:09) Loretta talks about an old bridge in her town -- (6:31) Ernest Ray talks about where he got his newest recording, from his mother -- (06:52) Ernest Ray talks about his little sisters wanting to record when they get older, and how wild they are -- (07:27) Loretta talks about taking her teen daughters on the road -- (07:45) Loretta tells a story about her daughter being caught gambling in a hotel -- (08:33) Loretta talks about the harsh winter they just had, and that it did not affect any of her shows -- (08:57) Loretta talks about her mother having a lung removed -- (09:45) Loretta talks about cutting Ernest Ray's song first, but letting her son have it first -- (10:13) True Love Needs To Keep In Touch (Ernest Ray Lynn) [recorded excerpt] -- (12:35) Weather report -- (15:13) Loretta talks about the pronunciation of Nashville -- (15:35) Loretta corrects her next tour destination -- (16:16) Your Squaw Is On The Warpath (Loretta Lynn) [recorded excerpt] -- (18:15) Loretta talks about the inspiration behind her record "Your Squaw Is On The Warpath" -- (19:17) Loretta talks about writing her own music -- (19:30) Loretta talks about doing a book about her lyrics, and that Coal Miner's Daughter is releasing later this year -- (20:41) Loretta talks about not starring in the movie, but helping with production -- (21:30) Loretta talks about why her sister's accent is different from her -- (21:42) Loretta talks about where Butcher's Holler, KY is located -- (22:00) Loretta talks about moving to Washington -- (22:15) Loretta talks about how she got her first record contract in Washington -- (24:05) Loretta and Jack talk about how newer artist's songs get into the Top 40 -- (25:15) Loretta talks about a hit only being a hit if it gets recognition -- (25:30) Loretta talks about why some hits don't get any radio play -- (27:00) Loretta talks about never changing -- (27:27) You Ain't Woman Enough To Take My Man (Loretta Lynn) [recorded excerpt] -- (29:50) Loretta and Jack conclude the interview -- (32:50) God Bless The Children (Loretta Lynn) [recorded excerpt]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Reno, Jack; Lynn, Loretta, 1932-; Lynn, Ernest; WLW (Radio Station : Cincinnati, Ohio);
